questions.question: 1. For two competing species (denoted 1 and 2), the population growth rate of species 1 in the presence of species 2 is.

answers.a: Lower at all population sizes of species 1 than in the absence of species 2.
answers.b: Zero when the population reaches K.
answers.c: Dependent on the carrying capacity of species 2.
answers.d: The same as in the absence of species 2.

questions.question: 2. What is the equilibrium population size of a species in the absence of competitors or predators?

answers.a: The population at which the per capita growth rate = 0.
answers.b: The maximum population size the environment can sustain.
answers.c: The population size at which dn/dt=0 (where N refers to the population size).

questions.question: 3. When is competitive exclusion likely to occur?

answers.a: When interspecific competition is less intense than intraspecific competition.
answers.b: When two species exhibit resource partitioning.
answers.c: When interspecific competition is more intense than intraspecific competition.
answers.d: When the inferior competitor has a refuge in the environment.
